page.title: 19CHICHESTER-THE CORPS.R.M.P.
page.content: { The Corps of the Royal Military {Police }has its origins reflected in the earliest accounts of the British Army. From the appointments of Provost Marshals has developed today's Corps. Since 1964 the U.K.Training Centre for the Corps has been in Chichester. They have close links with the local area & are freemen of the city.{The Royal {Military Police & City of Chichester {International March}has been an annual event in August since 1977. The aim of the March is to encourage physical well-being & to maintain the spirit of friendship and international goodwill. In 1984 it attracted 6000+ marchers from the U.K,Europe,Canada,U.S.A & the Gulf States. Teams and individuals can enter for the 40,25 or 10km distances. The March ends with a parade through Chichester, where the salute is taken by the Mayor & Military Dignitaries.
